title: Winsted Woods - Root 66 Series Race #5
description: Winsted Woods presented by Bikers Edge Root 66 Series Race #5
course: Course Description: The course is a challenging and technical 8 mile loop with 800 feet of elevation per lap. Everything is extremely well marked – same as last year. There will be new sections to the course this year. Above distances may change but you will be notified at the start the exact length of the course.
registration: Pre registration is available at www.bikereg.com and is $25 – must be completed before 11:59PM, March 17th – afterwards there is an $8 late fee, same applies to day of registration. One Day licenses are available for Cat 2 and Cat 3 only. Registration Opens at 8:00AM and closes 15 minutes prior to posted start times.
notes: Hot Food, Hooker Beer will be available all day, music and of course - bouncers for the kids. More information about the series is available at www.root66raceseries.com. Notes: Payouts will be 1-5 if at least 20 entries or 1-3 if less then 20 entries. The payouts will be up to half of the entry fees for Cat 1 and Pro Races. No refunds. Day of registration please pay with cash so we can payout with cash. Thank you!
directions: Directions: From Rte 44 Head West through the Center of Winsted Turn Right onto Spencer Street Turn Right onto Hinsdale Ave Turn Left onto Williams Ave Go to the end of the street and bear Right onto Williams Ave to the parking lot GPS: 200 Williams Ave, Winsted CT 06098 Contact info: Eric Carlson – 843-566-5259, email: teamedgecycling@gmail.com

title: CCNS Team and Individual State Time Trial
The Seven Lakes Ride
description: This is a fund raising event to benefit the patients of Eastern Connecticut Cancer Institute (ECCI) in Manchester, CT. Both routes are fully supported and begin in Stafford, CT.  So come out and \"Pedal for Patients\"!!!
course: The 62 mile route will travel through the charming rural towns of Willington, Ashford, Union, and Woodstock then head into the quaint southeastern Massachusetts towns of Sturbridge, Holland, and Wales before returning to Stafford. The 25 mile route will traverse the towns of Stafford, Willington, Union, Staffordville, and Stafford.
registration:
Date:	Sunday, June 30 2013
Time:	65 mile 8:00am start/$35 pre-reg
                25 mile 9:00am start/$25 pre-reg

Registration is from 7:30am to 9:00am
Day of ride registration will be an additional $10 for each ride so $35 for the 25 miler, $45 for the 62 miler, Please register online to save money!  
*T-shirts are guaranteed for the first 50 pre-registered riders.  We will be able to ensure t-shirts in your selected size for riders who register by June 15th so please register early!

title: Connor's Angels Bike Ride

address.street: North Haven Fair Grounds  Washington Ave

description: Eight mile fun ride through the streets of North Haven CT to support the Connor Kusmit Foundation. Connor at 16 was killed by a distracted driver while riding his bicycle.  The foundation's goal is to raise awareness and educate the public on bicycle and road safety to prevent other accident from happening.
course: Starting and ending at the North Haven Fairgrounds on Pool Rd North Haven CT 06473 (Rear Entrance)
registration:
Pre-registration through the connorkusmitfoundation.org web site is $35. Day of event $45.
Registration begins: 9:00am Ride starts: 10:00am.
directions:
North Haven Fairgrounds
Pool Road
North Haven, CT 06473
Rear Entrance

title: Silk City Cyclocross
description:
Expo Wheelmen present
Silk City Cyclocross
September 21, 2013
Manchester Community College
60 Bidwell Street
Manchester, CT
course: The most fun course in Connecticut
notes: All juniors are completely free, including one day license fee if needed.Regional champions can race for free in the category they are the champion of.  Must preregister and wear the regional champions jersy.  You will be comp'd at registration.  All USA Cycling rules apply.
directions:
Manchester Community College
60 Bidwell Street
Manchester, CT

title: Ashford Metric Century+
description: This is a fund raising event to benefit the Ashford Recreation Department. All routes are fully supported and include the quiet and rolling hills of Ashford, Eastford and Woodstock. Come out and enjoy the stunning fall foliage in classic New England.
registration: Registration starts at 7:00am and ends at 9:30am. 100 miler’s should be on the road by 7:30am, 62 miler’s by 9am and all other riders should be on the road by 9:45am. Day of ride registration will be an additional $10 for each ride except the 10 miler ($30 for the 25 miler, $35 for the 62 miler, and $45 for the 100 miler), so register online to save a little money!  https://www.bikereg.com/Net/18972
directions:
Ride starts at Ashford Elementary School on Route 89 in Ashford, CT

Ashford Elementary School

440 Westford Rd.

Ashford, CT 06278

From the South and Willimantic:

From Willimantic take Route 195 north toward The University of Connecticut. In Mansfield Center turn right onto Route 89. Follow Route 89 north into Ashford. Cross Route 44. Ashford School is located on Route 89 2 miles north of the intersection with Route 44.

From the West and Hartford:

Take I-84 East to Exit 69. Turn right onto Route 74. Follow Route 74 through Willington to Route 44 in Ashford. Turn left on Route 44 to the intersection of Route 89. Turn left on Route 89. The school is on the right 2 miles to the north.

From the North and Massachusetts:

Take I-84 to Exit 72. Turn left on Route 89. Follow Route 89 (south) watching the signs because it turns twice. Ashford School is located on the left side of Route 89 about 6 miles from I-84.

From the East and Rhode Island:

From the Rhode Island border take Route 101 west. It merges with Route 44 in Pomfret. Continue on Route 44 west until Route 89 in Ashford. Turn right on Route 89. Ashford school is located on the right about 2 miles north of Route 44.

title: TCC - Mansfield Hollow Cyclocross 2013
description: Thread City Cyclers Mansfield Hollow Cyclocross Race and Connecticut State Championships
course: Classic Cyclocross race. Approximately 1.2 mile loop. Rolling hills, flat fields, technical off camber, tight turns, man made and natural barriers, deep sand.
notes: Race dates back to the early 1980's. One of the oldest races in New England. A good mix of technical and flat fast racing in a beautiful setting in Mansfield Hollow State Park. Stated by riders as the "most fair cyclocross race in New England. Something for everyone".
directions:
Directions:
From Interstate 84 either direction exit 68 (UCONN Exit Rte 195 South):
Take Rt 195 South 11.5 miles through the University of Connecticut Campus.
Left onto Bassetts Bridge Rd (at light- T&B Motors on corner) following signs to Mansfield Hollow State Park.
Proceed 3/4 mile down the road- Race and Race Parking on the right.
 
From Providence and the East:
Route 6 West to the Junction of Rte 203 (Traffic Light).
Right turn following signs to Mansfield Hollow State Park.
Stay Left at Stop Sign and cross the bridge to Bassetts Bridge Rd.
Race and Race parking are on the left 3 miles up the road.
 
From the South:
Route 32 North to Rt 203 North.  Straight at junction with Rt 6. (traffic light)
Follow signs to Mansfield Hollow State Park.
Stay Left at Stop Sign and cross the bridge to Bassetts Bridge Rd.
Race and Race parking are on the left 3 miles up the road.
 
Mapquest/ GPS:
Enter Mansfield Hollow, Mansfield Center, CT 06250
41Deg45'37.26"N/ 72Deg10'47.18"W

title: Veterans Memorial CX Race p/b Team ERRACE.org
Hop Brook Cyclocross
description: 2013 Hop Brook Cyclocross to Benefit Naugatuck High School Cross Country Team Presented by Cycle Fitness of Monroe, CT
registration:
Pre-Registration ONLY
(except Kids 12 & Under race which is free)
Pre-register online at bikereg.com until
Saturday Nov. 15 at 10:00pm
Or send standard release form with fee to:
Cycle Fitness
755 Main Street, Suite 4A
Monroe CT 06468
1-800-240-BIKE
notes:
All USA Cycling Cyclocross rules apply
·   USAC license required for all riders
·   One Day license available for $10
·   One Day license holders may only race Cat 4/5
·   Helmets must be worn at all times while on
bike.
·   Mountain bikes allowed with no bar ends.
directions:
Directions: Hop Brook Lake, Middlebury CT
Take I-84 to Exit 17 to Route 63 (south). Follow
Rt. 63 (south) until it intersects with Rt. 188. The
park entrance of Hop Brook Lake is at the
intersection of Rt. 63 and Rt. 188.
